title: Freedom4All
author: Freedom4All
content: Hello all,Coming back here is nostalgy. I was active here 2016-2020.Wow, how things changed. I need to find my way here to fit in again.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Did you lose access to your original account or just chose to register a new one here?I have been here since late 2018 and from then till now very little has changed. If there's something this forum is known for it is not making any changes to how it operates and relying on the status quo of operations. You would have no issues fitting into the forum again if you've remained active with Bitcoin discussions in general.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Welcome back! It seems like you may have lost access to your old account, considering you mentioned being active here in the past. I hope everything is going well for you. As you can see, the crypto industry and this forum have undergone significant changes since your last visit. It's time to start fresh and stay up to date. Take some time to explore the forum, read through various threads, and familiarize yourself with the latest happenings. If you can't find the answers you're looking for, don't hesitate to ask questions. We're here to assist newcomers like you.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: I was going to ask the same but Upgrade00 had already asked, so i will just skip it. And i did not catch the verse Quotehow things changed because it looks like a statement but if it is a statement then i do not think anything changes (i know i am not that old but i trust upgrade00 (hehe. Just kidding).Welcome back to this platform, and let me tell nostalgia will hit you like something has changed so that's what you are suffering right now you need a doctor, or maybe you can spend some time and get familiar with the boards, new moderators, new members, new hype, new adoption, new developments in BTC blockchain etc. etc. to break your nostalgia.

comments.author: blackened515
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 23, 2023, 07:41:28 PMHello all,Coming back here is nostalgy. I was active here 2016-2020.Wow, how things changed. I need to find my way here to fit in again.Why did you come back with new account, what happened to your old bitcointalk account? What do you want to learn now that you are here again, can we expect to see you active here for about 2 years or you'll vanish again as you did before? Not trying to sound rude but to know if truly you've come to learn more here. Secondly, what have learnt so far before you left, what do you want to learn now you here, what challenges you encounter in the ecocrypto, can you solve them now or you still get more to learn. It's better you know your stand and be straightforward to studying crypto and Blockchain technology at large.

comments.author: Obari
comments.body: Just as every other user has asked,  I think it will be very wise of you to come answer some of this questions and at least ease the curiosity  of the users as some persons truly wanted to know what happened  to your account and if there was anyway anyone could you get access to it if you still  need it. I've been on the forum  for almost a year now and I haven't  ry noticed any significant changes so far and it seems the forum doesn't really make any reasonable changes to its mode of operations and I'm sure the forum wouldn't be any difficult for you since you've been once very active on the forum. Welcome.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Changed in terms of what?Bitcoin price? DeFi, NFT hype? Forum operations?Personally, from 2020 to this date, nothing much has changed except the crypto prices and maybe hype. Forum is still almost the same as it was with very minor changes.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: I have spent three year or so in the forum apart from the quality of starter thread dropping I don't think much has changed on the forum, even if there was a change it is not too noticable. And even though I wasn't here as far back as 2016 I believe in terms of the forum land scape not much has changed.I believe it would also be best to tell the forum about your previous account since you have already brought it on the table about you being here as far back as 2016 but this account you posting with was registered today

comments.author: Issa56
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 23, 2023, 07:41:28 PMHello all,Coming back here is nostalgy. I was active here 2016-2020.Wow, how things changed. I need to find my way here to fit in again.welcome back to the foum, i dont think their is any moderation in the forum rules and regulation, but since it as been long that you left the forum here, you might have forgotten some things, so i will like you to check out the forum rules and regulations Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQ, also this thread will also be useful Read before posting.  But you account was created today, how will you claim that you have been on the forum before. if you have being here before you should have just continued with the account, their is no use for you to create a new account or do you loss access to your old account?

comments.author: Mr.right85
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 23, 2023, 07:41:28 PMHello all,Coming back here is nostalgy. I was active here 2016-2020.Wow, how things changed. I need to find my way here to fit in again.For real!This feels so comic coming frm you right now.I mean, 2020 was just 3years ago, not completely 3years but, for someone who has been active through 2016-2020, finding your way around shouldn't be something to reference. The forum hasn't changed much except for the creation of a Nigeria local board and the addition of the notation OP to the starter of a thread.Can't say I wasn't disappointed when I saw on your profile that the account was created only today and your 2 days activity showed that, the account haven't been around very much or active too.I wonder,What happened go your active account? Why aren't you using those?

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Welcome back mate. You sound like a well established member here before your break. If I may ask did you by any means had any issues in the past that discouraged you from continuing here as a member? Or you lost access to your account? If you truly lost access you could be able to retrieve it back or possibly a change of hands because I was wondering if you have been here for this long based on what you posted here you should know your real account to access it mate.Sorry for me being too inquisitive. I am very curious to know mate.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Just like some others have already asked, I'm also curious. OP, what happened to your main account? The one you allegedly used the forum with until 2020. Have you lost access? Why don't you try to recover it? If you have lost your password or access to your email address, there are still methods you can use to recover your old account.

comments.author: kamvreto
comments.body: Mentioning yourself in detail will clear up any questions that arise. You say this is nostalgia then you already have a high ranking account of course and maybe it can't be accessed again, or you just end up as a newbie from start to finish.active from 2016 is a senior if you develop and have a good contribution in the forum.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 23, 2023, 07:41:28 PMHello all,Coming back here is nostalgy. I was active here 2016-2020.Wow, how things changed. I need to find my way here to fit in again.Welcome back! The reason for abandoning your former account is important. This is to ensure that you are not breaking the rules of the forum. But I guess you are aware of these rules because you have already spent four years in the forum. It will be good if you go through the forum and get more knowledge about new developments in the forum. There is also a need to read about the Bitcoin space and some recent development. I am sure some of your former mates or friends in the forum are still around and you will also find some new friends. There are also some new rules like the forum don't accept the use of artificial Intelligence to write post. The use of bots for post writing is highly prohibited just like plagiarism. I guess you know other rules even more than me. Not to worry in a few days you will be familiar with the forum again.

comments.author: dansus021
comments.body: If ypu lost your account or get hacked try this thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5089777.0 theymos creating it and this very helpful welcome back btw if you registered on 2016 maybe there is no merit system and beside that nothing change I think, Bitcoin price has changed hahahah buy more :-D

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Four years of activity is a long time. But what do you want to tell us all? Why didn't you come to the forum with your old account? After all, we see new accounts here daily that claim to be newbies, did you decide to change your statement to say that you are a former old-timer here? Tell me, then, who were you in a past life?

comments.author: BD Crypto
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 23, 2023, 07:41:28 PMComing back here is nostalgy. I was active here 2016-2020.Wow, how things changed. I need to find my way here to fit in again.You are again Welcome to this forum. Hope you will enjoy your new forum journey. If you are talking about changes of the forum nothing have changed at all. Because you last saw this forum at 2020 when merit system is already implemented.Many newbies have joined this forum and many newbies got higher ranks and that are the changes. And the another change is that you maybe lost your account access or been restricted so you are now starting from the beginning. If would be better if you make points about the changes and share with us.If you are talking about crypto industry then some changes happened like NFT launched, many new concept launch like MoveToEarn , Launched some new Blockchain etc.

comments.author: dderekwalcott
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 23, 2023, 07:41:28 PMHello all,Coming back here is nostalgy. I was active here 2016-2020.Wow, how things changed. I need to find my way here to fit in again.Yes! It has been a long time because 2016-2020 is a long time.A long way to go.Hope you get back to your previous  rhythm.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 23, 2023, 07:41:28 PM...Coming back here is nostalgy. I was active here 2016-2020.It would be interesting to hear from you the reasons why you left the forum. And since you claim that you were previously active on this forum, tell us about the reasons why you are not using your previous account. It would be interesting for us to read your previous posts to understand who you are.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Quote from: Freedom4All on June 23, 2023, 07:41:28 PMHello all,Coming back here is nostalgy. I was active here 2016-2020.Wow, how things changed. I need to find my way here to fit in again.Hello there, glad that you've been back. Yeah, a lot have changed since you haven't here for a long time but that's fine. What's important is that you're back so be active again. But even if you've been inactive for a long time, did you manage to accumulate and sold some during the 2021 bull run? And if yes, that's good and we're approaching another bull run anytime soon but most likely after the halving next year.If not, then learn from your experience and don't let this pass and accumulate while you can still right now before these prices inflates before and after the halving.
